answers.text:
Hi Matthew, 
On the Knowledge Network we have many orientation manuals that may be of use to you. 
-Elected Staff Orientation Manual- This manual pertains specifically to elected local government officials. https://icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/302278
-Board and Commission Orientation Manual- This manual is for the members of boards and commissions from Los Alamos County, NM.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14747/Board_and_Commission_Orientation_Manual
-Employee Recruitment, Orientation, and Retention- is a document from the City of Palo Alto, CA and covers the entire orientation process from employee recruitment to retention and keeping employees engaged. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/303069
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

answers.text:
Berkeley (California) has a great program for orienting and supporting people who serve on city boards and commissions. You can find their "Commissioners Manual" and other information at:  http://www.ci.berkeley.ca.us/Clerk/Commissions/Commissions__Commission_Manual.aspx
Paul Leistner
City of Portland Office of Neighborhood Involvement
paul.leistner@portlandoregon.gov

author: Matthew Fulton
text: I am interested in finding a community that has a well thought out manual for its advisory commissions/committees as well as orientation process and /or recognition program.  I am very interested in supporting our commissions in a way that helps them understand their roles and responsibilities and aligns their efforts with the City Council's strategic vision.  Thank you.
title: Municipal Advisory Commission manual and orientation process
